title: Colonial Pipeline Shutdown Threatens to Magnify Gasoline-Price Surge
summary: Cyberattack disrupts largest U.S. fuel conduit as more drivers are preparing to travel after getting coronavirus vaccines. The cyberattack that forced the closure of the top U.S. fuel pipeline threatens to disrupt gasoline supplies for millions, as the conduit's owner estimated Monday that restoring service would take at least through week's end.

title: Colonial Pipeline Hack Sparks Questions About Oversight
summary: Pipelines lack security regulations like those imposed on utilities and the maritime sector. The ransomware attack on Colonial Pipeline Co. has hit an industry that largely lacks federal cybersecurity oversight, leading to uneven digital defenses against such hacks.

title: Novavax Covid-19 Vaccine Faces Delay
summary: A shortage of raw materials will push back several regulatory and manufacturing targets for the vaccine, which is in the final stage of testing. Novavax Inc. has delayed plans to seek regulatory clearances for its Covid-19 vaccine, while shortages in raw materials are slowing the ramp-up in production of doses, the company said.

title: Biden's Latest Jobs Whopper
summary: Now he's just making it up.. President Joe Biden's empty boasts about his economic plan are going to make Americans long for the understatement of Donald Trump. They may already be longing for Trump-era policies on job creation.

title: Aid to State, Local Governments Is About to Flow
summary: Under Treasury rules, states must show they won't use the aid to pay for tax cuts. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration will begin distributing $350 billion to state and local governments this month, giving them money to pay for pandemic-related costs, fill revenue shortfalls and pay for water, sewer and broadband projects-but not to cut state taxes.

title: The Real Infrastructure Problem
summary: The Colonial Pipeline shutdown is a warning of worse to come.. The economic damage from the cyber attack that shut down the 5,500-mile Colonial Pipeline-the country's largest fuel pipeline-should be limited. But it's a glaring reminder that cyber vulnerabilities in U.S. energy and other systems are the real infrastructure problem that President Biden should be addressing.

title: Joe Biden, Labor Economist
summary: The President sees no problem from bonuses not to work. He needs to get out more.. After a disappointing April jobs report, President Biden on Monday told employers they have nothing to worry about. His view from Mt. Olympus, er, the White House tells him there's no problem with the federal unemployment bonus, and if there is, the answer is more spending.

title: Taiwan and the WHO
summary: China wants the island nation excluded despite its Covid successes.. The Trump Administration cited China's "total control" of the World Health Organization as it walked away from the international body, but rejoining was among Joe Biden's first acts as President. Watch this month for the first major test of the new Administration's ability to influence or reform the WHO.

title: The Fed Is Playing With Fire
summary: Clinging to an emergency policy after the emergency has passed, Chairman Powell courts asset bubbles.. With Covid uncertainty receding fast, and several quarters deep into the strongest recovery from any postwar recession, the Federal Reserve's guidance continues to be the most accommodative on record, by a mile. Keeping emergency settings after the emergency has passed carries bigger risks for the Fed than missing its inflation target by a few decimal points. It's time for a change.

title: Congressional Democrats' Court-Picking (Not Packing) Scheme
summary: Their election bill tries to game the judiciary by routing all legal challenges to the District of Columbia.. Congress probably won't pack the Supreme Court. But court picking poses a real threat to Americans' rights.

title: Strengthen Asia to Weaken Beijing
summary: China's opening to grab supremacy will vanish once its neighbors develop.. The American debate over China policy is heating up. Last month, Foreign Affairs published an article by Charles Glaser calling on the U.S. to retreat from East Asian commitments as American power declines. In prominent publications ranging from the National Interest to the Atlantic, analysts argue that the U.S. should moderate its China policy for the opposite reason: Beijing is a paper tiger and doesn't deserve this attention. Further out in the liberal mists, some blame hotheaded China hawks for violence against Asian-Americans and want a softer American China policy as a way of building community at home.

title: Robert Mueller's Revenge
summary: A judge's ludicrous tirade targets former Attorney General William Barr.. Federal Judge Amy Berman Jackson has an answer for all those hoping to heal and move on from the Trump years: Nothing doing.

title: 'Winning Independence' Review: The Road to Yorktown
summary: Some historians argue that the British could have escaped defeat and might have eventually dealt a mortal blow to the rebellious colonists.. Americans from childhood are regaled with stirring tales of Lexington and Concord, the crossing of the Delaware, Saratoga, and Valley Forge. They are told almost nothing, unfortunately, about what took place during the Revolutionary War after that. These storied events occur, and then-abracadabra!-Yorktown, with little in between and few connections drawn. In "Winning Independence," historian John Ferling seeks to fill in the blanks.

title: Notable & Quotable: Pete du Pont, 1935-2021
summary: 'This basic division is going to bedevil American society for some years to come.'. From Pete du Pont's Nov. 10, 2000, column for the Journal online. Du Pont served as governor of Delaware (1977-85), was a candidate for the 1988 Republican presidential nomination, continued his Journal column until 2014, and died Saturday at 86:

title: Roblox Sales Surge as Users Flock to Videogame Platform
summary: Loss widens on expenses tied to direct listing in March. Roblox Corp.'s first-quarter revenue more than doubled as the videogame company continued to benefit from pandemic-fueled demand for at-home social entertainment.

title: Foreign Entrepreneurs to Gain More Access to Immigration Program
summary: Biden administration plans to reverse a Trump-era proposal to kill International Entrepreneur rule. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration plans to revive an immigration program that lets foreign entrepreneurs work in the U.S. by withdrawing a Trump administration proposal that aimed to kill the program.

title: Liz Crotty Claims Law-and-Order Lane in Race for Manhattan District Attorney
summary: Endorsement from former NYPD Commissioner Ray Kelly follows others from police unions. Liz Crotty is cementing a position as the most traditional, law-and-order candidate for Manhattan district attorney in a group of more progressive contenders, with former New York City Police Department commissioner Raymond Kelly endorsing her campaign Monday.

title: U.S. Ship Fires Warning Shots at Iranian Boats in Hormuz Straits
summary: Encounter is at least the third between U.S. and Iranian craft in five weeks. WASHINGTON-A U.S. Coast Guard ship accompanying a Navy guided-missile submarine fired more than a dozen warning shots at a swarm of Iranian fast boats during a tense encounter in the Strait of Hormuz on Monday, a Pentagon spokesman said, in at least the third such incident in five weeks.

title: Tech Shares Weigh on Major Indexes
summary: Concerns that higher inflation may erode the value of future earnings is likely driving investors away from technology stocks. title: California Governor Proposes Tripling Spending on Stimulus Checks
summary: Most individuals would get $600, and families an additional $500, as state enjoys record budget surplus. California Gov. Gavin Newsom on Monday proposed a $100 billion economic stimulus plan that would triple the state's direct cash assistance program to reach an estimated two-thirds of residents.

title: NTSB Raises Doubts Fatal Tesla Crash Involved Autopilot
summary: Federal safety officials say video showed Model S owner entering the driver's seat before trip began. Federal safety officials have raised doubts that a fatal April crash of a Tesla Inc. car involved the vehicle's advanced driver-assistance system.

summary: Deal with blank-check company sponsored by investment firm Novator Capital values lender at around $7 billion pre-money. Startup mortgage lender Better plans to go public by merging with a special-purpose acquisition company, according to people familiar with the matter.

summary: 'The Green' is meant for lounging, reading, people-watching and pop-up performances. Lincoln Center has laid the groundwork for a Manhattan oasis-by blanketing its Josie Robertson Plaza with artificial grass.

title: U.S. Blames Criminal Group in Colonial Pipeline Hack
summary: DarkSide, a ransomware organization believed to be based in Eastern Europe, says it has no connection to foreign governments. A criminal gang believed to be based in Eastern Europe was involved in the hack that has led to the shutdown of the main pipeline supplying gasoline and diesel fuel to the U.S. East Coast, U.S. officials said Monday, as President Biden and others decried the ransomware attack that was used as a growing global problem.

title: Israeli Airstrikes Hit Hamas in Gaza
summary: Resume Subscription. JERUSALEM-Israel carried out airstrikes in Palestinian territory after militants in Gaza fired a barrage of rockets at Jerusalem for the first time since 2014, raising fears of a wider conflict following days of clashes between Palestinians and Israeli police in the contested holy city of Jerusalem.

title: New Jersey Lawmakers Threaten to Strike Back Against Congestion Pricing
summary: Legislation is being crafted to tax out-of-state drivers if New York pursues plan to charge drivers to enter lower Manhattan. A group of New Jersey lawmakers is threatening to retaliate if New York moves forward with its plan to charge drivers a fee to enter Manhattan's central business district.

title: Afghanistan's Terror Future
summary: Emboldened militants kill dozens of schoolgirls in Kabul.. The U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan undermines American security interests, but the humanitarian disaster may be more immediate. The attack on a school in Kabul over the weekend is a likely preview.

title: Coronavirus Strain Found in India Is a 'Variant of Concern,' WHO Finds
summary: B.1.617 becomes fourth variant so classified by agency, which says it may be more transmissible than some others. The World Health Organization on Monday classified a coronavirus variant first spotted in India as a global "variant of concern," saying preliminary studies showed it may be more transmissible than some other variants.

title: 'Daddy's Home' by St. Vincent Review: Sin City
summary: Annie Clark's latest album has a '70s-New York vibe and takes her father's release from prison as a jumping-off point to explore debauchery, regret and redemption..

title: Biden Says Unemployment Benefits Aren't Hampering Economy
summary: President says administration will make clear that workers receiving benefits can't turn down suitable jobs. WASHINGTON-President Biden pushed back Monday against Republicans and business groups who say enhanced jobless benefits are discouraging Americans from working, defending his economic prescriptions and saying his administration would make clear that people can't turn down suitable jobs and keep collecting benefits, except in specific circumstances.

title: Trial Begins for Lawyer Who Sued Chevron Over Ecuador Pollution

summary: Fuel prices are already high, for reasons unrelated to gasoline supply. The pipeline's shutdown could mean an expensive summer for drivers.. summary: Spain, France and Italy have moved to curb orders from hedge funds to avoid demand for new bonds from appearing inflated, bankers say. European governments are acting to limit hedge funds' participation in the market for new sovereign-bond issuance, following a surge in demand from the firms.

title: Corn Is the Latest Commodity to Soar
summary: Prices have risen roughly 50% in 2021, and a bushel costs more than twice what it did a year ago. America's biggest cash crop has rarely been more expensive. Corn prices have risen roughly 50% in 2021 and a bushel costs more than twice what it did a year ago.

summary: For some real-estate agents, showings are 'Little Shop of Horrors' Meets 'Jumanji'. Mercedes Menocal Gregoire

summary: A disruption in routines has contributed to worrying weight gains and weight-related health issues among children, pediatricians say. Pediatricians say they are seeing alarming weight gains in children and adolescents as many return for in-person visits for the first time since the pandemic began.

title: Catholic Priests in Germany Bless Gay Couples, Defying Pope
summary: Ceremonies are held across the country to protest a Vatican ban of the practice. Catholic priests across Germany are blessing same-sex couples in defiance of a recent Vatican ban on the practice, the latest effort by liberal German Catholics to build a more progressive version of their church.

title: States Urge Facebook to Abandon Plan for Children's Instagram
summary: Officials warn that the planned version of the platform for under-13s could harm kids. title: Tech Firm CIOs Are Wading Deeper Into Product Development
summary: Once just a slice of the job, building software for outside companies has become a front-and-center part of the CIO brief at enterprise tech firms in the last year. CIOs at enterprise tech firms are finding themselves in an area they previously seldom strayed into: building out software products and services for sale to other companies.

title: Following Bidding War, Montana Ranch to Sell for Around Its $136.25 Million Asking Price
summary: Climbing Arrow Ranch, near Bozeman, was publicly listed for less than a week before finding a buyer. A Montana ranch featured in the 1992 Robert Redford movie "A River Runs Through It" is in contract, less than a week after the listing was made public, the listing agent confirmed.

title: Seychelles Sees Renewed Covid-19 Surge Despite Vaccinations
summary: The country is experiencing its largest coronavirus outbreak after vaccinating some 60% of its population, mostly with China's Sinopharm shot. Seychelles, which has vaccinated a higher proportion of its population against coronavirus than any other country, is struggling to contain a new surge in Covid-19 infections, raising questions about the effectiveness of a Chinese shot the island nation has administered to the majority of its vaccinated residents.

title: Elliott Management Has Stake in Duke Energy
summary: The activist investor is urging the utility to add board members. Activist investor Elliott Management Corp. has a stake in Duke Energy Corp. and is pushing the utility to add directors to its board and possibly take other actions to boost its stock price, according to people familiar with the matter.

summary: It's critical to choose an interest rate that meets both parties' goals-and set up an arrangement that passes tax muster. Peter Lazaroff is chief investment officer at Plancorp and blogs at peterlazaroff.com.

title: How the Pandemic Helped Me Find Meaningful Work
summary: Looking to the future inspired me to become part of the solution around food justice and sustainability. Learning Japanese was one of the highlights of growing up in Tokyo. title: Is Biden's National Daycare Good for Children?
summary: The Biden administration's plan to expand child care isn't compulsory. It will help families, help employers get stable workers and help our children.. Regarding J.D. Vance and Jenet Erickson's "Biden's Daycare Plan Is Bad for Families" (op-ed, May 4): Attacks on advocacy for expanding availability and accessibility to developmentally supportive child care for America's children are mind boggling. The authors point to a Canadian study written by economists instead of looking to U.S. research by those who study child development and education. As a parent and pastor who values the foundation my university-educated children received attending a state-licensed child-care center, I don't look to economists for child-development expertise.

title: Section 1031 Helps Many and Is No Loophole
summary: Readers react to Biden's targeting of like-kind exchanges.. Regarding "New Proposal Takes Aim at Real-Estate Tax Loophole" (U.S. News, April 29): A 1031 like-kind exchange has never been a tax loophole. Like-kind exchanges allow investors to exchange one property for another similar "like-kind" property and pay gains taxes later when the property is liquidated. Section 1031 of the Internal Revenue Code is an established statute as legislated by Congress originally as part of the Revenue Act of 1921. Like-kind exchanges facilitate the overall flow of the real-estate-investment industry, with about 15% of all commercial-real-estate transactions in the U.S. being like-kind transactions. Additionally, those who rely most on section 1031 aren't large corporations, but individual Americans who own investment property, from urban apartments to farms to forests.

title: Colorado Drillers to Combine, as Consolidation Continues in Oil Patch
summary: Bonanza Creek Energy and Extraction Oil & Gas are the latest to tie up, creating a $2.3 billion company. title: All Alone in Real-Life Downton Abbeys, Lords and Ladies Fend for Themselves
summary: Pandemic restrictions mean Britain's historic mansions haven't had visitors, whose tickets pay for a lot of cleaners and gardeners, so duchesses and baronets pulled the weeds and did the dusting; Lord Hugo mows the lawn. After Covid-19 first sent Britain into lockdown in the spring of 2020, the owners of Highclere Castle, where "Downton Abbey" was set, had to banish visitors and send staff away. They closed the shutters and shrouded the furniture with dust covers in its 250 plus rooms.

title: U.S. Reverses Trump-Era Rollback of Gay, Transgender Protections in Healthcare
summary: HHS uses authority under Title IX of Civil Rights Act, cites Supreme Court ruling last year prohibiting discrimination against LGBT workers. title: The Derby Winner Failed a Drug Test. Will Medina Spirit Run in the Preakness?
summary: Organizers of the second leg of the Triple Crown face a decision on whether to allow trainer Bob Baffert to enter his horse before the investigation in Kentucky is fully completed. Now the question is whether Medina Spirit will be allowed to run in Saturday's Preakness Stakes after a failed drug test put its Kentucky Derby win in peril.

title: Vice Media Targets Nearly $3 Billion Valuation in Proposed SPAC Deal

title: Marriott Points to Rising Demand Amid Vaccine Rollout

summary: Resume Subscription. New York City taxicabs that idled for most of the pandemic are getting ready to hit the streets as Covid-19 restrictions ease and businesses prepare for a full reopening, city officials say.

title: The Money Question: Should You Go Back to the Office?
summary: It can be a complicated choice for those lucky enough to have a job, with mental health, physical fitness and professional prospects to consider. After months of experimenting with remote work, your company is calling you back to the office.
